title: Shooting that injured 11-year-old ruled accidental
content:
A shooting that landed an 11-year-old boy in the hospital earlier this week has been ruled accidental, according to the Aiken County Sheriff’s Office.
The incident occurred Monday afternoon on Nautilus Street in Aiken after the child and his 19-year-old brother were playing with a handgun that they found in a lock box, according to investigators.
The teenager removed the magazine from the gun but didn’t remove a bullet that was in the chamber. The teenager pointed the gun, pulled the trigger and his younger brother was shot in the right side of his face, investigators said.
The teenager immediately called for help.
Deputies and Aiken County EMS responded, and the child was treated at an area hospital.
“The investigation revealed that the 19-year-old brother was negligent however there was no criminal intent,” a press release read.
